meanings.definition: Of or relating to women or girls.
meanings.sent1: She wore a feminie dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The pink color is often considered feminie.
meanings.sent3: Her feminie charm won over the entire room.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a feminie paradise of flowers and butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The feminie energy in the room was palpable.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or appropriate or unique to women.
meanings.sent1: The soft fabric had a feminie touch.
meanings.sent2: Her feminie intuition guided her in making the right decision.
meanings.sent3: The feminie laughter filled the air with joy.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the feminie beauty of the subject.
meanings.sent5: She exuded a sense of feminie grace and elegance.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics traditionally associated with women.
meanings.sent1: The nurturing nature of the teacher was feminie.
meanings.sent2: The delicacy of the china set gave it a feminie feel.
meanings.sent3: His feminie side emerged when he cooked a gourmet meal.
meanings.sent4: The room was decorated in a feminie style with pastel colors.
meanings.sent5: The feminie strength she displayed was admirable.
